Latest West Ham news, analysis and fan views

Ask about West Ham - what do you want to know?

title: Can No. 9 Cougars extend winning streak to 11 games against Arizona State?
description: No. 9 BYU hosts rebuilt Arizona State on Wednesday at the Marriott Center before first matchup with rival Utah on Saturday in Salt Lake City.
fullText:
One of the best things about playing basketball in the Big 12 is that there is no such thing as a trap game, even when a matchup with your fiercest rival is on the horizon.

That has been BYU coach Kevin Young‚Äôs message to his team this week as it prepares for a Wednesday night showdown (7 p.m. MST, Peacock), its Big 12 home opener, at the Marriott Center with reimagined Arizona State (0-1, 9-5), a team that features three explosive scorers and a savvy, experienced and fiery coach, Bobby Hurley.

BYU (1-0, 13-1) finishes the week playing at rival Utah (0-1, 8-6) on Saturday, but Young said there will be no looking ahead. The Sun Devils have too much talent to overlook, and they were one of the better 3-point shooting teams in the country until their last three games, losses at UCLA and at home to Oregon State and Colorado.

Utah (0-1, 8-6) will play at Colorado on Wednesday night before hosting BYU in the Huntsman Center on Saturday night in what will be the first coaching meeting of Young and Alex Jensen, who also came to the college ranks from the NBA.

‚ÄúTo be honest, I haven‚Äôt even thought about Utah,‚Äù Young said Tuesday afternoon. ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre extremely locked in on Arizona State and trying to make sure we are dialed in for them. They are a good team, much better than they were last year.‚Äù

The Cougars swept the Sun Devils last year, winning 76-56 in Provo and 91-81 in Tempe.

Young said Arizona State is ‚Äútotally different‚Äù than it was last year, with sophomore guard Trevor Best the only holdover from a squad that went 4-16 in league play and 13-20 overall. Another familiar face on the ASU roster is 6-foot-8 redshirt sophomore Marcus Adams Jr., who played sparingly for BYU in 2023-24 before Young arrived in Provo. He‚Äôs averaging 3.6 points and 2.4 rebounds off the bench.

Pacific/Pepperdine transfer Maurice ‚ÄúMoe‚Äù Odum leads them in scoring with a 16.6 average, while NAIA University of the Cumberlands transfer Anthony ‚ÄúPig‚Äù Johnson chips in 14.1 points per game and 7-foot-1 freshman Massamba Diop of Senegal averages 13.6 per outing.

Arizona State‚Äôs best wins were over Texas and Washington State at the Maui Invitational and over Oklahoma and Santa Clara in December.

‚ÄúThey are talented. They did a good job finding good players. I am really impressed with several of their guys,‚Äù Young said. ‚ÄúThey are obviously super long, starting 6-10, 6-11, 7-1 (players) inside. And then the guard, Moe Odum, he‚Äôs as dynamic of a guard as we‚Äôve seen to date.‚Äù

Defense and 3-point shooting has abandoned Hurley‚Äôs bunch in the three-game skid. They are shooting 19.2% from beyond the arc during that stretch, after shooting 45.3% from deep in the three games before that, against lesser competition.

‚ÄúWe are in a tailspin right now from behind the 3-point line, and we have made a lot of those shots,‚Äù Hurley said after the Colorado loss. ‚Äú‚Ä¶ We have to solve our rebounding, and we have to solve our interior defense.‚Äù

Meanwhile, BYU enters its first home game since Dec. 22 as one of the hottest teams in the country, and unbeaten in Big 12 play after its 83-73 win at Kansas State last Saturday. The Cougars have won 10-straight games for the first time since the 2010-11 season (when they did that twice) and have won nine-straight Big 12 regular-season games dating back to last year.

Star wing AJ Dybantsa leads the country in scoring (23.1 ppg.) and sophomore guard Rob Wright III, a transfer from Baylor, has been ‚Äúunbelievable as well,‚Äù Young said.

‚ÄúRob‚Äôs experience in our league is also something that I think I‚Äôve not only relied on, but will rely on even more as we move forward in conference play,‚Äù Young said.

The Cougars last won nine-straight regular-season conference games in 2020, when they were in the West Coast Conference.

‚ÄúWe are fairly happy with where we are at,‚Äù said senior wing Richie Saunders after he, Dybantsa and Wright combined to score 52 points against KSU. ‚ÄúThere are so many things we are still growing at, still getting better at. I feel good about where we are at, but we still need to grow more. ‚Ä¶ We want to peak at or near the end of conference play. But I like where we are currently at.‚Äù

title: Tuesday Cheese Curds: Packers turn to playoffs after long last month
description: It‚Äôs time for playoff football after a slog through the last month of the regular season.
fullText:
What do you make of these playoff-bound Green Bay Packers?

There is no shortage of possible opinions. Maybe they‚Äôre a shambolic mess, maybe they‚Äôre a sleeping juggernaut, maybe they‚Äôre a badly bruised and broken team that should have been much better, maybe they‚Äôre some combination of all these things and more.

But they are, above all, a playoff team ‚Äî for whatever that gets them. In the short term, that gets them a matchup with the Chicago Bears. In the long term? Who knows? There‚Äôs no team in the NFC or AFC playoff field that feels impossible for the Packers to beat, though some are certainly more challenging than others. But can they get it done?

That‚Äôs been the question for the Packers all year, even when they were at their best and healthiest, and it‚Äôs still the question now. They have to face a tough Bears team on Saturday night. Can they get it done? We‚Äôre about to find out.

Top 10 plays that got Packers into playoffs | Packers.com

The last month of the season wasn‚Äôt much to write home about, but there were plenty of great plays that got the Packers to the playoffs.

NFL playoff myth-busters: Why you‚Äôre wrong about all 14 teams | ESPN

There‚Äôs plenty to digest about all 14 of the NFL‚Äôs playoff teams.

11 things you may have forgotten from last Packers-Bears playoff game | Packers News

It‚Äôs been 15 years since the Packers faced the Bears in the playoffs. Maybe it‚Äôs time for B.J. Raji to finally make his return?

Packers rookie Collin Oliver produces 4 pressures in NFL debut | Packers Wire

It‚Äôs been a long time coming, but Collin Oliver finally got into the lineup.

Aaron Rodgers clinched the dignified end he deserved, if this is indeed goodbye | The Athletic ($)

Aaron Rodgers‚Äô career seems to be winding down, but he went out with a good regular season game.

AI-generated police report states Utah officer was turned into a frog | UPI

AI truly is revolutionizing things.

title: Whomever replaces John Harbaugh as Ravens coach has to fix Lamar Jackson
description: Jackson's greatness didn't lead to late-game rallies or playoff win streaks. John Harbaugh was judged on that. His successor will be, too.
fullText:
John Harbaugh was a very good and occasionally great NFL head coach. But with Lamar Jackson in tow, he trended squarely toward the former.

After missing the playoffs in 2025 and with a 3-5 postseason record with the two-time MVP in tow, the Baltimore Ravens decided they'd seen enough. Harbaugh made it past Black Monday. He didn't last beyond Tuesday; the Ravens fired him two days after Baltimore's season ended with a missed 44-yard field goal in Pittsburgh.

2025 was a perfect storm for the Ravens, who managed to stave off postseason elimination until the very last second of the regular season anyway. The defense fell apart under former rising star coordinator Zach Orr. An undermanned receiving corps was effectively a one-man show. And, most importantly, Lamar Jackson didn't look anything like the best version of himself.

Injuries played a part. Jackson was, per usual, as banged up as you'd expect a running quarterback to be. He missed four starts due to injury and left two other games with hamstring and back injuries. But when he did play, he was a fraction of the quarterback he once was in every facet of the game.

His passing output dropped from 245 yards per game to 196. His sack rate exploded from 4.6 percent to 10.6. Negative plays compounded while explosive ones dwindled. His expected points added (EPA) per dropback fell from 0.29 in last year's first-team All-Pro campaign (best in the NFL) to -0.04 (22nd, just behind a 42-year-old Aaron Rodgers). His average target distance, deep ball and tight window rates all remained roughly the same but the delivery changed, leading to a significant dropoff. His 72.4 percent on-target throw rate was the lowest of his career.

TJ WATT PICKS OFF LAMAR ON THE DEFLECTED PASS.

BALvsPIT on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/ViXTN12C7G

That threatened to make him the run-to-paper-over-bad-throws quarterback detractors falsely accused him of being early in his career. Instead, his ground game shrank in lock step with his aerial regression.

Jackson went from 8.2 rushing attempts per game in 2024 -- then a career-low -- to 5.2, running less often than nine other NFL quarterbacks including Justin Fields and Jaxson Dart. His success rate, measured by how often a play gains at least 40 percent of yards required on first down, 60 percent of yards required on second down, and 100 percent on third or fourth down, ranked first in the NFL at 64.3 percent in 2022.

In 2024, it hit 56.1 to rank fifth among all qualified runners and second only to Jayden Daniels among quarterbacks. In 2025, his 5.2 yards per carry came with a career-low 47.8 percent success rate. That's the first time it's dipped below 50 percent and good for 48th place among all players and seventh among QBs.

There is hope this was all injury related and a rebound is near. But cracks began to show even before injury turned the offense over to Cooper Rush (horrible) and Tyler Huntley (mostly fine). He dazzled through the air in Weeks 1 through 4 and still went 1-3 in those games. He was sacked 15 times in those games, including seven times by the Detroit Lions -- something that's only ever happened once before in 116 regular season starts. He ran the ball fewer than four times per game. While he was efficient through the air, it was in a way that didn't swing games.

That leads us back to a problem that's persisted throughout his career. Jackson traditionally tends to come up short in close battles. He has 13 career game-winning drives in 115 regular season and postseason starts. He had five such drives in 62 games since 2022. Bo Nix, on the other hand, had seven game-winning drives in 2025 alone. Caleb Williams had six.

Back in Week 1, he couldn't sustain the late drives to keep the Buffalo Bills from coming back from a 40-25 deficit in the final four minutes (obviously Baltimore's deficient defense deserves some blame as well). Early fourth quarter stall-outs kept him from delivering a home win against Detroit in Week 3.

Week 18 saw him dazzle late to keep the Ravens punching in a sloppy heavyweight de facto playoff game in Pittsburgh.

LAMAR. ZAY. WOW.

RAVENS TAKE THE LEAD.

BALvsPIT on NBC
Stream on @NFLPlus + Peacock pic.twitter.com/RLFrGLddRj

While Tyler Loop's missed kick wasn't his fault, the previous loss to the Steelers -- 27-22 after Jackson led four different fourth quarter drives into Steeler territory at home and came away with exactly two field goals and nothing else -- kinda is.

That was Harbaugh's problem with Jackson. He couldn't turn his quarterback's dazzling heroics into the wins that mattered. Baltimore is 76-31 with its star quarterback at the helm in the regular season. It's 3-5 in the playoffs with a single trip beyond the Divisional Round, zero postseason win streaks and zero Super Bowl appearances to show for it.

Jackson's passer rating drops from an NFL-best (ever!) 102.2 in the regular season to 84.6. His sack rate goes from 7.3 to 10.4. Even though he improves a bit as a runner in January, it's not enough to cover his failings.

The Ravens took all this in. They decided good was, in fact, the enemy of great. They opted to venture into the unknown rather than head back to the playoffs with a sinking feeling of failure enveloping them.

Restoring Jackson isn't the only pressing issue Baltimore's new coach will face. The defensive identity of one of the league's hardest-hitting teams has been cracked and needs to be rebuilt. Derrick Henry is 31 years old and can only keep this up for another one, two decades tops.

But ultimately, Harbaugh's replacement will be judged on his ability to turn Jackson into something more than a regular season award magnet. Improvement may be easy to come by once the dynamic quarterback is healthy again. It won't mean anything until he starts stringing together comeback wins or rallying Baltimore to multiple playoff victories.

This article originally appeared on For The Win: Whomever replaces John Harbaugh as Ravens coach has to fix Lamar Jackson

title: Veteran Penn State DE Zuriah Fisher commits to transfer to USC
description: USC has beefed up its defensive line room once again, landing Penn State defensive end transfer Zuriah Fisher out of the NCAA Transfer Portal. Fisher, a fifth-year redshirt senior, appeared in 11 games this season for the Nittany Lions and had his best statistical season yet. The 6-foot-3, 265-pounder totaled 19 tackles, 3.5 TFLs and [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
USC has beefed up its defensive line room once again, landing Penn State defensive end transfer Zuriah Fisher out of the NCAA Transfer Portal.

Fisher, a fifth-year redshirt senior, appeared in 11 games this season for the Nittany Lions and had his best statistical season yet. The 6-foot-3, 265-pounder totaled 19 tackles, 3.5 TFLs and a pair of sacks while also forcing a fumble.

‚ÄúI think internally within our program, I think there is a lot of confidence that Fish has got a chance to have a big year,‚Äù former head coach¬†James Franklin¬†said¬†of Fisher prior to this season. ‚ÄúHe‚Äôs like one of those guys that I don‚Äôt think anybody‚Äôs talking about right now, outside of the program, based on just not seeing him recently, but there‚Äôs a lot of excitement internally, with our players, with our staff. I think those things are really apparent.‚Äù

That came after sitting out the 2024 campaign due to injury, giving him a medical redshirt that season. In 2023, Fisher played in all 13 of the team‚Äôs games, notching 16 tackles, 3.5 tackles for loss and three sacks. Prior to that, he appeared in 10 games over his first three seasons with PSU.

A member of the Class of 2020, he is expected to have one year of eligibility remaining with the Trojans. As a high schooler, Fisher was a four-star prospect and tabbed as the nation‚Äôs No. 320 overall recruit and No. 20 EDGE in his class.

Now, after finishing his sixth year at the college level this fall, he‚Äôll look for a breakout opportunity in Los Angeles. The Trojans are expected to bring back their top three pass rushers in underclassmen Kameryn Crawford, Jide Abasiri and Braylan Shelby.

The young trio totaled 13.5 sacks last season, and USC also brings in one of the nation‚Äôs premier defensive end recruits in five-star Luke Wafle. With so much young talent, a veteran presence like Fisher could elevate the Trojans into one of the best pass-rushing groups in the country next year.

title: Browns request to interview Seahawks DC Aden Durde for head coach
description: Seattle's defensive coordinator has risen quickly
fullText:
The Seattle Seahawks are looking like victims of their own success. While the players are getting an extra week of rest due to the No. 1 seed, their coaches are busier than ever... even with non-Seahawks related matters. Offensive coordinator Klint Kubiak is already getting plenty of requests from teams around the league to be their head coach, such as the Atlanta Falcons, but he isn't the only Seahawks coach drawing interest.

On Tuesday afternoon, NFL insider Ian Rapoport broke the news the Cleveland Browns have officially requested to interview Seahawks defensive coordinator Aden Durde for their open head coach position. Although head coach Mike Macdonald is the one who calls the plays on defense, Seattle's success on that side of the ball can certainly be attributed to help from Durde as well.

The #Browns have requested permission to interview #Seahawks DC Aden Durde for their vacant HC job, source said.

The native of England came to the NFL as a #Cowboys coaching intern and has risen quickly.

‚Äî Ian Rapoport (@RapSheet) January 6, 2026

Durde has been the Seahawks' defensive coordinator for the last two seasons. Personally, I had some hope with Macdonald being the one who calls the plays, Durde might've remained a well-kept secret in the Pacific Northwest.

NFL organizations cannot deny a coach from interviewing for a position that is an upgrade, so if Durde is interested in throwing his hat in the ring with the Browns, it will be up to him.

As for Kubiak, several other teams in the league have joined the Falcons in asking permission to interview him for their vacant head coaching spots. However, according to Albert Breer, Kubiak is still figuring out what to do with the requests.

Seahawks OC Klint Kubiak has gotten requests to interview for the Giants, Cardinals, Raiders and Falcons head coaching jobs, per source. His focus is on the playoffs, so he'll take a day or two and figure out a plan to balance all of it.

Seattle is on a bye as the NFC's 1 seed.

‚Äî Albert Breer (@AlbertBreer) January 6, 2026

Both of Seattle's coordinators getting interview requests is a challenge the Seahawks will have to navigate during the bye week. Teams can often lose focus during this time if they are not careful, which often results in catastrophic losses. Seattle needs to find a way to balance everything, as Breer mentioned in the tweet above, in order to maximize this rare opportunity for a potential Super Bowl run.

This article originally appeared on Seahawks Wire: Cleveland Browns request to interview Seattle Seahawks DC Aden Durde

title: Only Bo Melton misses Green Bay Packers Jan. 6 practice ahead of playoffs
description: The Green Bay Packers went through a walkthrough practice Jan. 6, and only one player was absent.
fullText:
GREEN BAY - The Green Bay Packers held a walkthrough practice Jan. 6 as they prepare to open the playoffs against the Chicago Bears in the NFC wild-card round.

Since the team didn't hold a full practice, participation reports are an estimation, and only one player was held out.

PACKERS NEWS: Matt LaFleur expects Packers right tackle Zach Tom back for playoffs

Here's the latest from Jan. 6 practice.

Packers all-purpose player Bo Melton was the lone player who didn't participate in practice.

Melton, who is a key contributor on special teams, injured his knee while making a tackle on punt team in the second quarter of the regular-season finale against the Minnesota Vikings.

According to the Packers' injury report, Warren Brinson (foot), Javon Bullard (knee), Edgerrin Cooper (shoulder), Nick Niemann (IR/pectoral), Zach Tom (back/knee), Dontayvion Wicks (concussion), John Williams (IR/back) and Malik Willis (shoulder/hamstring) were limited participants in practice.

Matthew Golden (Achilles) and Lukas Van Ness (foot) were full participants.

Packers quarterback Jordan Love is off the injury report.

Love suffered a concussion in the Week 16 road game in Chicago and was inactive the following week against the Baltimore Ravens. He cleared protocols heading into the Vikings game and was listed as backup to Clayton Tune, but didn't play in the game.

Packers quarterback Malik Willis, who's dealing with an injured shoulder and hamstring, was a limited participant in practice.

Packers coach Matt LaFleur said he expects Willis to be available as Love's backup against the Bears.

This article originally appeared on Packers News: Only Bo Melton misses Packers Jan. 6 practice ahead of playoffs

title: Ravens players found out about John Harbaugh's firing on social media
description: According to Giana Han of the Baltimore Banner, most Ravens players learned of the dismissal on social media before a scheduled 6:00 pm Zoom meeting with DeCosta and others.
fullText:
The Ravens are usually tight-lipped about 53-man roster cutdowns and other business dealings, but the John Harbaugh firing on Tuesday came so quickly that neither the head coach nor the front office had a chance to warn or brief the players. According to Giana Han of the Baltimore Banner, most Ravens players learned of the dismissal on social media before a scheduled 6:00 pm Zoom meeting with DeCosta and others.

Players have indicated that they found out John Harbaugh was out through social media or friends reaching out to them.

Apparently, they got a notification around 5:55 for a team Zoom at 6, well after the news had broken and with just a few mins heads up as many are moving out.

‚Äî Giana Han (@giana_jade) January 6, 2026

title: Patriots Recruiting Wide Receiver Help Before Playoffs, Free-Agent Tryouts
description: The New England Patriots went to battle last Sunday with a limited wide receiver room. Veteran pass catcher Mack Hollins missed his second consecutive game. Hollins went on the injured reserve after an injury suffered in Week 16. He will be on the sideline until at least the AFC Conference Championship Game. Undrafted rookie receiver [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
The New England Patriots went to battle last Sunday with a limited wide receiver room.

Veteran pass catcher Mack Hollins missed his second consecutive game. Hollins went on the injured reserve after an injury suffered in Week 16. He will be on the sideline until at least the AFC Conference Championship Game.

Undrafted rookie receiver Efton Chism III played in 44% of the offense‚Äôs snaps against the Miami Dolphins, just one week after logging a career-high 41 snaps played in the blowout win over the New York Jets.

Chism was the team‚Äôs sixth receiver all season, but has had to step up in Hollins‚Äô absence.

As such, there is room for one more receiver on New England‚Äôs practice squad as a post-season insurance policy.

The Patriots hosted two free-agent wide receivers on Tuesday to potentially fill this vacancy, ESPN‚Äôs Mike Reiss reported on X.

The first was former Division II standout Cole Burgess. Burgess recorded 3,133 yards in his four-year career for the Cortland Red Dragons. He tallied 87 receptions for 1,375 yards and 16 touchdowns as a senior. He has spent the last two seasons on the Cincinnati Bengals‚Äô practice squad.

The other receiver is the New York Jets undrafted free agent rookie signing Dymere Miller. Miller was a practice squad player for the Patriots‚Äô AFC East rival, and he, too, took a unique route to the NFL.

He began his college career playing for FCS Monmouth in New Jersey. In his third year at Monmouth, he was a Walter Payton Award finalist (the FCS version of the Heisman Trophy). In that historic season, he set school records for single-season receptions with 90, single-season receiving yards with 1,293 and a single-game record when he recorded 333 receiving yards in a loss to UNH.

Miller then transferred to Rutgers, where he played a more than respectable senior season that earned him a spot on an NFL roster.

No signings have been made, but the Patriots have remained diligent in pursuing potential roster-strengthening opportunities.

Patriots Rumors: Assistant To Interview For Head Coaching Vacancy

title: Yuki Kawamura's path to playing time after signing with Bulls
description: Injuries to Josh Giddey and Coby White offer opportunity for Kawamura.
fullText:
Yuki Kawamura's path to playing time after signing with Bulls originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Chicago Bulls made a roster move Tuesday, bringing back fan favorite Yuki Kawamura on a two-way deal.

After an impressive run in the 2025 NBA Summer League with Chicago, it seemed certain that Kawamura would compete for minutes deep into the rotation. In five Summer League games, Kawamura averaged 10.2 points, 6.2 assists, 2.4 rebounds and 2.2 steals while showcasing impressive vision in 23.9 minutes per game.

That said, it never worked out that way, as Chicago's roster was stacked with guards like Josh Giddey, Coby White, Kevin Huerter, Tre Jones and Jevon Carter.

As a result, the Bulls waived Kawamura prior to the season.

However, they've brought him back now, waiving Trentyn Flowers to complete the move.

This will give Kawamura his first opportunity of the season to earn NBA minutes. Last year with the Memphis Grizzlies, Kawamura only appeared in 22 games, averaging 4.2 minutes per contest. In limited action he averaged 1.6 points and 0.9 assists. In the G-League for Memphis, Kawamura averaged a double-double with 13.7 points and 10.7 assists per game.

Although, he could earn an opportunity sooner rather than later as Giddey remains sidelined with a hamstring injury. Additionally, White has been listed as questionable for Chicago's next matchup against Detroit.

Kawamura will have his first chance to suit up against the Pistons Wednesday and again Thursday versus the Miami Heat on the second night of a back-to-back.

title: Why Buccaneers fans have easy reason for 2026 optimism
description: Tampa had a poor 2025 season, but can it bounce back in 2026?
fullText:
Why Buccaneers fans have easy reason for 2026 optimism originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

A classic tale of two halves can best describe the Tampa Bay Buccaneers' 2025 season.

Starting 5-1, Tampa was flying, but then the collapse happened, and the franchise finished 8-9 and missed the playoffs.

For the first time in five years, the Buccaneers weren't in the playoffs and weren't NFC South champs.

Todd Bowles has had his future questioned, and the defense had poor moments, as did the offense.

But for CBS Sports' Josh Edwards, one reason for hope in 2026 lies squarely at the feet of Baker Mayfield.

"Tampa Bay has a collection of pass catchers who rival almost anyone in the league when healthy," Edwards wrote. "Quarterback Baker Mayfield is as consistent as any in the league, but there was clearly something bothering him in the second half of the season. Assuming he returns to full health, there is no reason to think that team could not return to form in 2026."

More:Todd Bowles gives outstanding response over Buccaneers future

They can. But one thing must be done for that to happen.

The franchise has to get on top of its crippling injuries.

In the back-to-back seasons, the Buccaneers suffered mightily with injuries. In 2024, they were lucky enough to overcome it. In 2025? Not so much.

The offense has enough key pieces for the Buccaneers to bounce back with ease. But the defense for most is where the problems are, and that's Bowles' department.

We have seen the Baltimore Ravens move on from John Harbaugh, and for some Bucs fans, Bowles should follow suit.

But the key to a 2026 revival lies with Baker and this star-studded offense.

title: Kansas visits top 2027 QB target Dane Weber
description: Kansas last signed a blue-chip quarterback prospect in the 2011 cycle when four-star Brock Berglund landed in Lawrence ‚Äî albeit for a short period of time. Could the Jayhawks land a top QB in the 2027 cycle? That remains to be seen, but they are a top contender for Temecula (Calif.) Chaparral four-star Dane Weber. [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Kansas last signed a blue-chip quarterback prospect in the 2011 cycle when four-star Brock Berglund landed in Lawrence ‚Äî albeit for a short period of time.

Could the Jayhawks land a top QB in the 2027 cycle? That remains to be seen, but they are a top contender for Temecula (Calif.) Chaparral four-star Dane Weber.

The 6-foot signal-caller made multiple trips to Lawrence in 2025. He‚Äôs gotten familiar with the KU staff, and on Monday, he was visited by offensive analyst Eric Terrazas:

Appreciate your time and effort @CoachTraz 

Amazing home Visit!!! @KU_Football@Kotelnicki @KUCoachZ @CoachLeipold #ROCKCHALK pic.twitter.com/Am9v9krdT6

‚Äî Dane Weber (@DaneWeber08) January 5, 2026

When speaking with Rivals‚Äô Greg Biggins around New Year‚Äôs Day, Weber tabbed Kansas as one of two schools pushing the hardest entering 2026. The Jayhawks have clearly made Weber a priority and he‚Äôs feeling the love.

Cincinnati, Colorado and Washington have all made their presence felt in Weber‚Äôs recruitment to this point, too. There‚Äôs other programs that he expects to come and see him throw ahead of the busy spring period, including Oregon and Auburn.

‚ÄúIt will be good to connect with those coaches and see where I‚Äôm at on their boards,‚Äù Weber told Biggins. ‚ÄúThe transfer portal is opening up and I‚Äôm interested to see where everyone ends up. By end of January, I want to cut it down and then set up trips. The plan will be to take my visits and then make my decision in late Spring.‚Äù

Weber is the No. 357 overall prospect and No. 25 QB in the 2027 cycle, according to the¬†Rivals Industry Ranking, a weighted average that utilizes all major recruiting media companies. He‚Äôs also the No. 35 recruit in California.

Biggins writes this of Weber, who put together a nice campaign in 2025:

‚ÄúWeber had a big junior season and is one of the nation‚Äôs true dual-threat quarterbacks. He‚Äôs a pocket guy who can carve up a defense and threw for 3,645 yards and 41 touchdowns while completing 70% of his throws.¬†He can take off and run at any time and rushed for 688 yards and 14 touchdowns on the ground and is the type of signal caller who can stress a defense with his arm and his legs.‚Äù

KU is currently without a commitment in its 2027 class. Last month, it inked 17 prospects, compiling the No. 54 class in the nation, according to the Rivals Industry Team Recruiting Rankings.

Head coach Lance Leipold and Co. did sign a QB as Maize (Kan.) Northwest three-star Jaylen Mason opted to stay home. He‚Äôs now Rivals‚Äô No. 49 QB and No. 6 recruit in the Sunflower State.

title: Chicago Bulls' Coby White expected to sit out one game of a back-to-back
description: The Bulls look to take precautionary measures to preserve Coby White's availability
fullText:
Chicago Bulls' Coby White expected to sit out one game of a back-to-back originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The Chicago Bulls have been dealing with a plethora of injuries since the start of the 2025-2026 campaign. Josh Giddey will be out due to a hamstring injury for two weeks. Zach Collins is out with a sprained right toe, but is expected to return on January 10th. Jalen Smith is out with a concussion, while Matas Buzelis is down with an illness, despite both being listed as day-to-day.

Coby White joined the fray after reinjuring his right calf during his game against the Minnesota Timberwolves on December 29th. He would miss the next three games against the New Orleans Pelicans, Orlando Magic, and Charlotte Hornets. He would return to play against the Boston Celtics, but came off the bench while being placed on a 25-minute restriction.

Although he had an off-night, scoring just 5 points while going 2-7 from the field and 1-5 from the three-point line, it‚Äôs clear the Bulls are taking precautionary measures to slowly ease White into the rotation. With Josh Giddey out, the team will depend on White to carry out his offensive responsibilities along with veteran Nikola Vucevic. However, it‚Äôs only possible if White remains healthy as he finally gets over the stagnant calf injury that sidelined him for most of the season.

MORE:Bulls sign 5-foot-7 fan-favorite guard, cut ties with second-year wing

With this in mind, White is questionable for his matchup on Wednesday against the Detroit Pistons. This is the first game of a back-to-back before the Bulls would go on to play the Miami Heat on Thursday for the second night. The franchise might limit White to play just one game while resting for the other due to injury management. Expect to hear more closer to gametime with the Pistons on his availability.

title: Harbaugh's firing opens the door for ex-Eagles assistant to lead an NFC East rival
description: The rumor mill is churning, and John Harbaugh is being linked to the Giants vacancy
fullText:
Football is theatre. For someone who has chosen journalism as a career, it's easy to appreciate a good story. One of the most important of Tuesday's news cycle involves a former Philadelphia Eagles assistant. John Harbaugh has been fired. He leaves the Baltimore Ravens after leading them for nearly two decades.

Around these parts, we've been busy talking about the Birds in Philadelphia, but The Flock in Baltimore has been equally fascinating. Their story involves a 30th-anniversary campaign, disappointment, and ultimately a loss in the NFL's final regular-season game. That eliminates them from postseason contention.

Harbaugh has been on the hot seat all season and is now unemployed, but he won't be for long. ESPN's top NFL insider Adam Schefter reports that at least seven teams have inquired about his services. That includes one team that hasn't fired its head coach yet.

What does this have to do with the NFC East, you ask? We appreciate the question. Lines are being drawn connecting the dots representing John Harbaugh and the New York Giants. Schefter released his report on that also.

Sources: John Harbaugh is expected to emerge as a favorite for the head coaching job of the New York Giants.

Harbaugh will be in demand for many teams, not just the Giants.

‚Äî Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) January 6, 2026

John Harbaugh comes from Andy Reid's coaching tree. He spent ten seasons as the Eagles' special teams coordinator and defensive backs coach. It's sad that his tenure in Baltimore ends partially because of a special teams miscue.

After having spent so much time here, it isn't shocking to find an Eagles fan who still loves him. That all goes out of the window however if he lands in Gotham as the leader of the hated Giants.

This article originally appeared on Eagles Wire: John Harbaugh is the favorite for the New York Giants job

title: Packers' Malik Willis gets $50 million contract update from ESPN analyst
description: Willis has set himself up quite nicely.
fullText:
Packers' Malik Willis gets $50 million contract update from ESPN analyst originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

Everything is setting up perfectly for Malik Willis.

The Green Bay Packers' talented backup quarterback is set to be a free agent when the season ends. And in each cameo he has gotten to make in place of Jordan Love, Willis has performed admirably.

Now, everyone is wondering what kind of deal Willis might get.

Will someone make him a starter? Will anyone pay him like a starter? What's a deal look like for a guy with this resume?

MORE:¬†Why Browns' nightmare QB history doomed Kevin Stefanski

ESPN analyst Dan Orlovsky, a former NFL QB himself, sees a big payday coming, writing this on X:

Malik Willis is gonna get 40-50 million this off season

‚Äî Dan Orlovsky (@danorlovsky7) January 6, 2026

Orlovsky doesn't say it, but that has to mean in total value.

It'd likely max out at something like two years for $40 million total, or maybe three years for $16.7 million each year.

Whatever it works out to be, Willis is looking at a special opportunity.

MORE:¬†A missed field goal changed everything for Mike Tomlin and John Harbaugh

He didn't pan out immediately in the NFL with the Titans, and the Packers got him in a trade for just a seventh-round pick.

But under head coach Matt LaFleur, Willis has grown. His running has remained dangerous, but he's also improved his accuracy and game processing in such a way that makes him an all-around threat.

Given that it's not often that new, exciting QBs spring out of nowhere, Willis will be tempting for a lot of teams to try. It feels like he's got untapped upside.

And with QB-needy teams around the league, someone is going to pay Willis. At this point, it's not even a matter of how much, because a payday is coming. We'll just wait to see from whom.

title: Which team suits Jeremiyah Love in this years upcoming NFL draft
description: Being the number one running back in the upcoming draft comes with pressure not only from the player himself but also from the teams selecting.
fullText:
Which team suits Jeremiyah Love in this years upcoming NFL draft originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

As the 2026 NFL Draft approaches, one name rising quickly on scouts‚Äô boards is Notre Dame‚Äôs dynamic running back, Jeremiyah Love. Considered a top prospect and projected as a potential first-round pick, Love is generating significant buzz due to his rare combination of size, speed, and versatility. Mock drafts frequently link him to teams like the New Orleans Saints, Kansas City Chiefs, and Minnesota Vikings, with other franchises such as the New York Giants, Jets, and Arizona Cardinals also reportedly interested.

Standing out at 6-foot-1 and around 220 pounds, Love combines downhill power running with breakaway speed, making him a threat between the tackles and in the open field. His 2025 season was remarkable; he set Notre Dame‚Äôs single-season touchdown record, proving his ability to find the end zone with consistency.

But Love isn‚Äôt just a runner. He‚Äôs a polished receiver out of the backfield, frequently lining up as a wide option and showing great hands and route-running ability. This dual-threat skill set is essential in today‚Äôs NFL, where running backs must impact the passing game as much as the ground game. Love‚Äôs willingness and ability as a pass protector further increase his value, showing he can handle the complexities of NFL blocking schemes.

One of the teams most commonly associated with Love in mock drafts is the New Orleans Saints. The Saints have a strong quarterback in place and a talented receiving corps, including Chris Olave, but lack a true star running back. Love would bring a new dimension to their offense with his downhill running style and receiving skills. The Saints also need to bolster their offensive line, but Love‚Äôs versatility would allow them to maximize their existing weapons.

Similarly, the Kansas City Chiefs could be an ideal landing spot. Pairing Love with Patrick Mahomes would provide a dynamic, multi-dimensional offensive threat capable of creating mismatches against defenses. The Minnesota Vikings, looking to rejuvenate their backfield, also make sense given Love‚Äôs potential to be a long-term solution in their offense.

The debate about drafting running backs in the first round remains lively. While some analysts are cautious due to the importance of offensive line play, recent first-round backs like Bijan Robinson and Jahmyr Gibbs have proven how impactful the position can be with the right supporting cast. Saquon Barkley, another top-10 running back pick, demonstrated his full potential only after moving to Philadelphia, highlighting how situational fit is crucial.

Love fits the mold of a first-round back who can immediately influence a team‚Äôs offensive identity. His combination of power, speed, and receiving ability offers a unique weapon that can change the way defenses prepare.

Ultimately, Jeremiyah Love is more than just a running back; he is a multi-faceted offensive weapon ready to make an immediate impact in the NFL. While some teams may hesitate to use a first-round pick on a running back due to positional value debates, Love‚Äôs talent and fit with teams in need could see him selected in the top 15 or even top 10.

If the Saints or Chiefs decide to prioritize offense in the early rounds, Love‚Äôs name will be among the first called a player who can bring explosiveness and versatility to an NFL offense hungry for game-changers. His draft stock continues to rise, and many believe he could redefine the value of the running back position in 2026.

title: OL Jake Guarnera withdraws from transfer portal, returning to Michigan
description: BREAKING: OL Jake Guarnera has taken his name out of the transfer portal and is returning to Michigan for the 2026 season!
fullText:
The Wolverines received more good news, as offensive lineman Jake Guarnera has taken his name out of the transfer portal and is returning to Michigan for the 2026 season.

‚Äî Jake Guarnera (@GuarneraJake) January 7, 2026

Guarnera is the second player to withdraw from the portal for the Wolverines on Tuesday, as it was reported earlier in the day that cornerback Zeke Berry would also be returning to Michigan.

Guarnera was a mainstay on the Wolverines‚Äô offensive line from Week 3 onward this past season. He made his first career start against Central Michigan at right guard following an injury to initial starter Brady Norton, and Guarnera started at that spot the rest of the year.

He was the highest-graded Michigan offensive lineman on Pro Football Focus (69.5 overall grade) in 2025 and is now expected to have a major role for Kyle Whittingham‚Äôs first squad in Ann Arbor.

The interesting part about Guarnera hopping in the portal in the first place is that he told reporters down in Orlando during the week of the Citrus Bowl that he intended to stay with the program, but then entered the portal just a few days later anyways.

Regardless of the exact circumstances that led him to the portal, it‚Äôs good to have him officially back in the mix for the 2026 season. Welcome back, Jake!

title: John Harbaugh becomes instant betting favorite for Giants job
description: John Harbaugh has landed on the coaching market.
fullText:
John Harbaugh has landed on the coaching market. And the betting markets have quickly responded.

Harbaugh is the instant favorite to become the new coach of the Giants, with odds of +150. The prior favorite, former Browns coach Kevin Stefanski, is +175.

Harbaugh is also 8-1 to become the coach of the Titans, 10-1 to become the coach of the Browns, +650 to coach the Falcons, and +450 to coach the Raiders.

It would be awkward, to say the least, for Harbaugh to land with the Raiders, given that the Ravens are widely believed to have instigated the #Deflategate scandal of 2015, by telling the Colts that the Patriots (and quarterback Tom Brady) were using deflated footballs.

Regardless, the Ravens decided to make a change after 18 years with Harbaugh. The question for Harbaugh is whether to take a job now or to wait a year, monitoring all developments for the best opportunity in 2027.

Few think Harbaugh won't continue to coach. The only question is where, and when, he'll continue a career that could end with a bronze bust in Canton.

title: Ohio State wide receiver Quincy Porter plans to enter NCAA transfer portal
description: Ohio State wide receiver Quincy Porter plans to enter the NCAA transfer portal, according to On3‚Äôs Hayes Fawcett. Porter wound up spending just one season with the program after being a big-time recruit. He will soon be on the open market and presumably have a ton of suitors waiting on the other end. Porter played [‚Ä¶]
fullText:
Ohio State wide receiver Quincy Porter plans to enter the NCAA transfer portal, according to On3‚Äôs Hayes Fawcett. Porter wound up spending just one season with the program after being a big-time recruit. He will soon be on the open market and presumably have a ton of suitors waiting on the other end.

Porter played high school football at Oradell (NJ) Bergen Catholic, where he was a five-star prospect. He was the No. 22 overall recruit in the 2025 cycle, according to the Rivals Industry Ranking, a weighted average that utilizes all four major recruiting media companies.

Only two wide receivers were ranked ahead of Porter. Oregon‚Äòs Dakorien Moore was one of them, followed by Kaliq Lockett of the Texas Longhorns.

Rivals was higher on Porter than the rest of the industry. He came in as the No. 13 overall prospect in the Rivals300. Only one other service ranked him as a five-star. Expectations for what Porter can become certainly are high.

Few in the college game are better than Brian Hartline at recruiting wide receivers. Hartline got Porter into the mix back in June 2024, holding onto the verbal all the way through National Signing Day. Schools such as Alabama, Michigan, and Penn State were considered other contenders at the time.

Hartline is no longer in Columbus, though, after leaving to become USF‚Äòs next head coach. Ohio State did hire Cortez Hankton to replace him as the wide receivers coach. But Porter is still going to at least entertain the idea of continuing his playing days elsewhere.

As for his on-field production, Porter played in four games this season. Only four catches came his way for a total of 59 yards. Wide receiver is a loaded position at Ohio State, making playing time hard to come by, even for somebody as talented as Porter.

Looking at the future, four years of eligibilty should remain. Porter only playing in four games means a redshirt can be taken by him.

Ohio State just saw its season end on New Year‚Äôs Eve in the Cotton Bowl. Miami was on the right side of a College Football Playoff quarterfinal, taking down the reigning national champions. Day and the entire Buckeyes staff now work toward building a roster capable of getting back to the top in 2026.

To keep up with the latest players on the move, check out On3‚Äôs Transfer Portal¬†wire.¬†The¬†On3 Transfer Portal Instagram account¬†and¬†Twitter account¬†are excellent resources to stay up to date with the latest moves.

title: Report: Commanders QB coach David Blough a candidate for Lions offensive coordinator
description: A former Lions quarterback is in the mix to be the team's next offensive coordinator.
fullText:
A former Lions quarterback is in the mix to be the team's next offensive coordinator.

Ian Rapoport of NFL Media reports that Commanders quarterbacks coach David Blough is the first identified candidate for the job. There's no word on the timing of Blough's interview with the team.

Blough began the season as Washington's assistant quarterbacks coach and took on the main responsibilities after Tavita Pritchard left to become the head coach of Stanford. Blough joined Washington in 2024 after wrapping up his playing days in 2023.

Blough's last stint with a team was on Detroit's practice squad that year. He was also with the Lions from 2019 to 2021 and appeared in seven games. Five of those appearances were starts during his rookie season and he also made two starts for the Cardinals in 2022.

title: John Harbaugh‚Äôs firing by Baltimore Ravens could be good news for the Giants
description: After 18 seasons with the Ravens, Harbaugh could become the top candidate for the Giants.
fullText:
The Baltimore Ravens have fired long-time head coach John Harbaugh.

The New York Giants have reportedly had conversations regarding Harbaugh with respect to their vacant head coaching position. It‚Äôs expected that the Harbaugh would be the top candidate, hurdling former Browns coach Kevin Stefanski.

While nothing has been announced yet, Harbaugh could be scheduled for am immediate in-person interview as an unemployed candidate.

The Ravens have become the seventh team to have a head coaching vacancy after firing Harbaugh. The Giants have widely been regarded as having the top opening, but the Ravens are clear competition for the top candidates ‚Äî save Harbaugh.

There does appear to be a mutual interest between the Giants and Harbaugh. Ian O‚ÄôConnor of The Athletic is reporting that Harbaugh is likely the Giants‚Äô top target, and the Giants are likely the top opening for Harbaugh.

John Harbaugh has a high regard for the Giants job and for Jaxson Dart. Of the six HC openings, I believe he might have the Giants at No. 1, or damn close to it. As I wrote yesterday, I believe he hurdles Kevin Stefanski as the leader in the clubhouse. https://t.co/VQDooMaV74

‚Äî Ian O'Connor (@Ian_OConnor) January 6, 2026

Harbaugh will be sought after, per Adam Schefter.

In the first 45 minutes after John Harbaugh was fired this afternoon, his agent Bryan Harlan said he received calls from seven NFL teams expressing interest in his client. 

There currently are seven NFL head coach openings, including Baltimore‚Äôs. pic.twitter.com/ey5vYsLcrZ

‚Äî Adam Schefter (@AdamSchefter) January 6, 2026

Stefanski will interview in-person on Wednesday, which he is allowed to do because he is not currently employed by a team. Harbaugh would now also fit into that category.

The Giants have also either requested or are expected to request interviews with Denver Broncos defensive coordinator Vance Joseph, Indianapolis Colts defensive coordinator Lou Anarumo, former Washington Commanders offensive coordinator and Arizona Cardinals head coach Kliff Kingsbury, Seattle Seahawks offensive coordinator Klint Kubiak and Giants interim head coach Mike Kafka.

Writers at SB Nation‚Äôs Baltimore Beatdown are trying to process Harbaugh no longer being the Ravens‚Äô coach.

title: Injury report for Spurs-Grizzlies: Is Victor Wembanyama playing?
description: The injury report for the matchup between the San Antonio Spurs and the Memphis Grizzlies provides updates on Victor Wembanyama and others.
fullText:
Injury report for Spurs-Grizzlies: Is Victor Wembanyama playing? originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The San Antonio Spurs (25-10) are traveling to Memphis to take on the Grizzlies (15-20) in a battle of Western Conference teams on Jan. 6.

Both teams are coming into the matchup having lost previous games, but the Grizzlies are currently on a four-game losing streak. On the other hand, the Spurs are coming off losing to the Portland Trail Blazers after winning the two before.

Heading into the matchup, the game's injury report had some convincing news on Spurs superstar Victor Wembanyama.

According to the NBA's latest injury report, the Spurs listed Victor Wembanyama (knee) as available for Tuesday against the Memphis Grizzlies.

ESPN's Michael C. Wright wrote that, similarly to the recovery process of Wembanyama's calf strain earlier in the season, which resulted in missing 12 games, the 22-year-old will come off San Antonio's bench and play with a minutes restriction.

The Spurs are hoping that the big man can put the injuries behind him and stay healthy for the rest of the season.

Devin Vassell (adductor) will miss his fourth straight game.

For the Grizzlies, they have a long list of players missing Tuesday's matchup. Ja Morant (calf), Cedric Coward (ankle), Zach Edey (ankle), Ty Jerome (calf), Brandon Clarke (calf), Scotty Pippen Jr. (toe), and John Konchar (thumb) are all listed as out.

Vince Williams Jr. (patellar tendinitis) will be available and most likely be in the starting lineup with all of the injuries to Memphis.

title: Nebraska lands UNLV transfer Anthony Colandrea after losing Kenny Minchey's pledge
description: Former UNLV quarterback Anthony Colandrea committed to Nebraska on Jan. 6, after the Cornhuskers lost one-day pledge Kenny Minchey.
fullText:
Nebraska football finally has its transfer portal quarterback after some trials and tribulations.

The Cornhuskers landed a commitment from former UNLV quarterback Anthony Colandrea on Jan. 6, a day after former Notre Dame quarterback Kenny Minchey flipped his pledge from Nebraska to Kentucky. Minchey committed to Nebraska on Jan. 4 before changing his mind Jan. 5.

Colandrea was the Mountain West Player of the Year in 2025 after passing for 3,459 yards with 23 touchdowns to nine interceptions, also rushing for 649 yards and 10 scores. He was a two-year starter at Virginia before transferring to UNLV, where he starred for first-year coach Dan Mullen.

REQUIRED READING: Day after committing to Nebraska, Notre Dame QB Kenny Minchey signs with Kentucky

The 6-foot signal caller is the No. 175-ranked player and No. 21 quarterback, according to 247Sports' transfer portal ratings. He's listed as a three-star recruit, per the recruiting service, and also took a visit to Florida State. Minchey was listed as a four-star recruit and No. 12 quarterback.

Colandrea is tasked with replacing two-year starter Dylan Raiola, who entered the transfer portal after suffering a season-ending injury. Raiola, a former five-star recruit, is still uncommitted.

Nebraska finished 7-6 in 2025 despite entering the season with lofty expectations. Raiola's injury didn't help, of course, leaving the program with true freshman TJ Lateef, who made four starts. The Cornhuskers went 1-4 in their last five games.

Colandrea is looking to bring some much-needed dual-threat ability to an offense that's losing star running back Emmett Johnson to the NFL draft, along with veteran receiver Dane Key.

This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Nebraska football lands UNLV transfer Anthony Colandrea as next QB

title: On3 trends for turning off X comments to prevent Grok AI from spoiling paywall
description: This is a fascinating modern problem.
fullText:
On3 trends for turning off X comments to prevent Grok AI from spoiling paywall originally appeared on The Sporting News. Add The Sporting News as a Preferred Source by clicking here.

The On3 Sports recruiting website is a popular destination for commitment information, transfer rankings and much 

It has also made a social media decision on X which is very much a dilemma for modern times.

On3 turned off replies to its posts on X because of AI.

X, formerly Twitter, has an AI feature known as Grok. A poster can ask Grok any question, and the artificial intelligence will answer.

When articles are behind paywalls, like they often are for On3, Grok can help someone know what is in the article without someone having to click into it and pay a subscription.

MORE:¬†Notre Dame QBs have lost their last 25 NFL starts

Grok doesn't always have the perfect answer to questions anyway, but it's still a notable move by On3.

A site like that, which specializes in exclusive recruiting information, needs subscribers to pay the reporters who have tracked down such information.

If people are able to get around the paywall and not pay a subscription, it threatens the very ecosystem of such a publication.

It'll be interesting to see if other subscription-based services take steps like this as the world of AI gets deeper and more intricate. For now, On3 may be at the start of a trend.

title: My husband and I spend Christmas and New Year's traveling. We love never knowing where we'll be for the holidays.
description: As a child-free couple with remote jobs, we choose not to spend Christmas and New Year's gathering with family. Instead, we travel somewhere new.
fullText:
When most of us think of the holidays, we picture spending them with family ‚Äî and that's exactly what my husband and I did for over 20 years.

Our tradition was to stay in Los Angeles to be with my parents, grandparents, aunts, uncles, and cousins, who all lived within driving distance of our home.

It was always fun eating tamales, dancing to traditional ranchero music, and laughing at my dad's nonsensical jokes. However, as time has passed, things have changed.

Old relationships ended, and new ones began, and loved ones passed away, including my dad and grandparents. Life also took a big turn once my husband and I both started working remotely in 2020.

Since then, we've become much more spontaneous and creative about how we spend the holidays. We never really know where we'll be, and that's part of what makes it so exciting.

My husband and I are close to our families, so sometimes it still feels a little weird not to spend the holidays with them. But they're supportive of our travels, and we see them throughout the year.

Because we have no children or pets, we try to make the most of our flexibility and freedom. This is especially true during the holidays, when we usually have one to two weeks off from work.

It's a chance for us to rest (and reset) our minds, and enjoy each other's company without worrying about deadlines and meetings.

For the first couple of trips on our own, we stayed within driving distance of home.

After several days in Phoenix during the 2021 Christmas holiday break, we rented a condo in the Catalina Foothills of Tucson. It had the most magnificent views of the city, and that trip remains one of my all-time favorites.

Aside from our daily walks among the saguaro cactuses, we didn't do anything major, which was exactly the point.

It was enough to take in the views, bask in the sunshine, and visit a couple of fantastic local spots ‚Äî Coronet, a top-notch restaurant-bar with a charming outdoor patio, and Motosonora Brewing Company, a cool tap room and beer garden.

The following year, we continued the relaxed desert theme and spent the holidays in Palm Springs and Joshua Tree, where a couple of friends met up with us. We loved the wide-open skies, stunning natural landscapes, and the overall slower pace.

In 2023, we wanted to go bigger, so we splurged on a 10-day vacation to Isla Mujeres, a tiny island off the coast of Canc√∫n.

Though this wasn't our favorite trip ‚Äî and we made a few mistakes planning it ‚Äî swimming in the warm turquoise waters of the Caribbean was incredible, and we don't regret the experience.

Most recently, we spent the 2025 to 2026 holiday season in Paris, a trip we didn't even plan until the last minute.

My husband grew up on the East Coast and has missed having a wintry Christmas ever since we've been together, so we figured we may as well go to our favorite city.

It was magical. From the gorgeous store decorations and festive street lights to the outdoor Christmas markets and caf√©s serving vin chaud (mulled hot wine), it felt like we were living in a holiday movie ‚Äî one that we didn't want to end.

Fortunately, it didn't have to. Although the holidays are officially over, we were able to extend our stay in Paris through February, where we'll continue working remotely.

Though we absolutely love to travel, we're not wealthy, so we're always mindful of our expenses. But when we feel it's worth it, we don't hesitate because we know life is short, nothing lasts forever, and we want to follow our bliss while we can.
